results.name: Irregular triangle read by rows: T(n,k) is the number of involutions of length n that have exactly k inversions; n>=0, 0<=k<=binomial(n,2).
link: Alois P. Heinz, Rows n = 0..40, flattened
formula: T(n,k) = T(n-1,k) + Sum_{j=1..n-1} T(n-2,k-2*(n-j)+1) for n>=0, k>0; T(n,k) = 0 for n<0 or k<0; T(n,0) = 1 for n>=0. - _Alois P. Heinz_, Mar 07 2013
maple: T:= proc(n) option remember; local f, g, j; if n<2 then 1 else
f, g:= [T(n-1)], [T(n-2)]; for j to 2*n-3 by 2 do
f:= zip((x, y)->x+y, f, [0$j, g[]], 0) od; f[] fi
xref: Cf. A008302 (permutations of [n] with k inversions).
